$params : \ArrayObject

A convenient reference to the Config::$params object, which itself is contained by the Forge object.

$locked

$locked : bool

Is the Container locked? (When locked, you cannot access configuration properties from outside the object, and cannot set services.)

Type

bool

See also

__get()

__get(string $key) : mixed

Magic get to provide access to the Config::$params and $setter objects.

Parameters

string $key

The property to retrieve ('params' or 'setter').

Returns

mixed

todo

__clone()

__clone() : void

When cloning this Container, *do not* make a copy of the service objects. Leave the configuration and definitions intact.

Tags

todo

lock()

lock() : void

Lock the Container so that configuration cannot be accessed externally, and no new service definitions can be added.

Tags

todo

isLocked() : bool

bool

has()

has(string $key) : bool

Does a particular service definition exist?

Parameters

string $key

The service key to look up.

Returns

bool

Tags

todo

set()

set(string $key, object $val) : $this

Sets a service definition by name. If you set a service as a Closure, it is automatically treated as a Lazy. (Note that is has to be a Closure, not just any callable, to be treated as a Lazy; this is because the actual service object itself might be callable via an __invoke() method.)

Parameters

string $key

The service key.
object $val

The service object; if a Closure, is treated as a Lazy.

Throws

\Aura\Di\Exception\ContainerLocked

when the Container is locked.

\Aura\Di\Exception\ServiceNotObject

Returns

$this

Tags

todo

get()

get(string $key) : object

Gets a service object by key, lazy-loading it as needed.

Parameters

string $key

The service to get.

Throws

\Aura\Di\Exception\ServiceNotFound

when the requested service does not exist.

Returns

object

lazy()

lazy(callable $callable) : \Aura\Di\Lazy

Returns a Lazy containing a general-purpose callable. Use this when you have complex logic or heavy overhead when creating a param that may or may not need to be loaded.

$di->params['ClassName']['param_name'] = $di->lazy(function () {

     return include 'filename.php';
 });

Parameters

callable $callable

The callable functionality.

Returns

\Aura\Di\Lazy —

A lazy-load object that contains the callable.

Tags

todo

lazyGet()

lazyGet(string $key) : \Aura\Di\Lazy

Returns a Lazy that gets a service. This allows you to replace the following idiom .

..

 $di->params['ClassName']['param_name'] = $di->lazy(function() use ($di)) {
     return $di->get('service');
 }

... with the following:

 $di->params['ClassName']['param_name'] = $di->lazyGet('service');

Parameters

string $key

The service name; it does not need to exist yet.

Returns

\Aura\Di\Lazy —

A lazy-load object that gets the named service.

Tags

todo

newInstance()

newInstance(string $class, array $params, array $setters) : object

Returns a new instance of the specified class, optionally with additional override parameters.

Parameters

string $class

The type of class of instantiate.
array $params

Override parameters for the instance.
array $setters

Override setters for the instance.

Returns

object —

An instance of the requested class.

Tags

todo

lazyNew()

lazyNew(string $class, array $params, array $setters) : \Aura\Di\Lazy

Returns a Lazy that creates a new instance. This allows you to replace the following idiom:

$di->params['ClassName']['param_name'] = $di->lazy(function () use ($di)) {

     return $di->newInstance('OtherClass', [...]);
 });

... with the following:

 $di->params['ClassName']['param_name'] = $di->lazyNew('OtherClass', [...]);

Parameters

string $class

The type of class of instantiate.
array $params

Override parameters for the instance.
array $setters

Override setters for the instance

Returns

\Aura\Di\Lazy —

A lazy-load object that creates the new instance.

Tags

todo

lazyRequire()

lazyRequire(string $file) : \Aura\Di\Lazy

Returns a lazy that requires a file. This replaces the idiom .

..

$di->params['ClassName']['foo'] = $di->lazy(function () {
    return require "/path/to/file.php";
};

... with:

$di->params['ClassName']['foo'] = $di->lazyRequire("/path/to/file.php");

Parameters

string $file

The file to require.

Returns

\Aura\Di\Lazy

Tags

todo

lazyInclude()

lazyInclude(string $file) : \Aura\Di\Lazy

Returns a lazy that includes a file. This replaces the idiom .

..

$di->params['ClassName']['foo'] = $di->lazy(function () {
    return include "/path/to/file.php";
};

... with:

$di->params['ClassName']['foo'] = $di->lazyRequire("/path/to/file.php");

Parameters

string $file

The file to include.

Returns

\Aura\Di\Lazy

Tags

todo

lazyCall()

lazyCall(mixed $callable) : \Aura\Di\Lazy

Returns a Lazy that invokes a callable (e.g., to call a method on an object).

Parameters

mixed $callable

callable The callable. Params after this one are treated as params for the call.

Returns

\Aura\Di\Lazy

Tags

todo

newFactory()

newFactory(string $class, array $params, array $setters) : \Aura\Di\Factory

Returns a Factory that creates an object over and over again (as vs creating it one time like the lazyNew() or newInstance() methods).

Parameters

string $class

THe factory will create an instance of this class.
array $params

Override parameters for the instance.
array $setters

Override setters for the instance.

Returns

\Aura\Di\Factory

Tags

todo
